column5: I am heading to Lac Seul in a week. This will be our first trip, just looking for some tips on colors, lures etc... that work well on this body of water. Any tips are appreciated. Thanks!

Right now there are a couple things going on here. 1. there is a weedline walleye bite in 8-12 feet and 2. the walleye have moved to the big water (baisns) and are holding in 18-25 feet on islands, humps/reefs etc. Colour doesn't seem to matter for jigs, they all catch fish. Having said that, I do tend to use glow, chart., white, pink and orange a lot. Another tip... follow the wind! Fish structure that is being hit by the wind/waves. Good luck!
Thanks for the tips. Hopefully walleye fishing goes well and then we can target some pike any advice on fishing pike in the same area of the lake?
try vaughn and any areas with cabbage
Weeds, stumps, reefs close to shore. If there is a weedline walleye bite there will be big pike nearby.

I have fished that area a few times at this time of year....WEED!....find the cabbage in 10' to 15' of water. I have even fished a creek up that way off a small bay...they were in as little as 2' of water in thick weed...we had to cast slip bobbers to small weedless pockets....very effective.
